<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/best-of-nepa.jpg" alt="Nepal Tour Package" title="Nepal Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Want to get rejuvenated and to escape away from the hectic life of your city? If yes, then plan a tour to Nepal with “Best of Nepal” tour package and buckle up yourself for a hassle free holiday. Explore the wonders of Kathmandu and at Chitwan enjoy some enrapturing elephant and safari rides along with the pictorial landscapes at Nagarkot and Pokhara. Be assured to get some really admiring adventurous activities on this short period of journey.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Nepal Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrival at Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>On your arrival at the capital city of Nepal, Kathmandu, you will be escorted by our tour representative. He will take you to the pre-booked hotel for the check-in and freshen up. Rest at the hotel and enjoy the lifestyle and modern architecture work of the city, its admiring blend of ancient and modern day influence.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Sightseeing at Patan</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast we will leave for the city tour. First of all, we will visit the divine Pashupatinath Temple which is situated along the riverbanks of Bagmati River. Pashupatinath Temple is a paragon of Hinduism in Nepal which is dedicated to Lord Shiva and then we will move towards the largest and the oldest Buddhist structure in Nepal, Boudhanath. Further, we will move on to Patan/Lalitpur the city famous for its cultural heritage. The other destination which we will cover is Kathmandu Durbar Square which houses a huge statue of Lord Hanuman and also there are some other temples in the premise. Patan which is famous for its incredible handicrafts houses tents for refugees is also included in our itinerary. The sightseeing trip of the day ends up with the visit of Swayambhunath Stupa whose all four sides are beautifully painted as Buddha’s eyes. The painting of the eyes seem like it is watching the entire country.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Chitwan</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After a healthy breakfast we will drive towards Chitwan. The national park in Chitwan was the first national park established in the country and is also declared as World Heritage Sites declared by UNESCO. The park houses a wide variety of wild plants and animals including one-horned rhinoceros, crocodiles, Bengal Tiger, and many other exotic birds. You can enjoy safari rides, elephant rides, and nature walks in this beautiful national park. Exploring national park takes most time of the day so after visiting the park we will come back to the hotel for overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Pokhara Visit</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast we will go to explore Pokhara which is famous for its beautiful landscapes including rivers, greenery, and tranquillity. After reaching Pokhara, we will check-in at the hotel and then rest for some time. In the afternoon, we will leave for the sightseeing trip and Bindabasini Temple which is dedicated to Goddess Durga is the first sightseeing destination of the day. Next, we will leave for the Devi’s Fall which is a very beautiful lake located on the opposite side of the sacred Gupteshwar Cave. After exploring the beautiful places of Pokhara we will return to the hotel for an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Exploring Nagarkot</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Next morning after breakfast, we will drive back to Kathmandu and will move towards Nagarkot from where we get the imposing views of Mt. Everest and also the beautiful view of rising and setting of the sun. After your arrival at Nagarkot, you will be taken to the hotel for check-in and then rest for some time. Afterwards, we will leave for the day’s sightseeing trip and you must be tired by evening so in the evening we will return to the hotel, have dinner and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>End of the Journey</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast you will be taken back to the Kathmandu Airport and with this your beautiful journey with us ends here.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Nepal Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Are Tourists Drawn To Nepal?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Nepal is a popular destination for mountaineers, rock climbers, and adventure seekers, as it is home to eight of the world's ten highest mountains. Nepal's Hindu, Buddhist, and other cultural heritage sites, as well as the year-round pleasant weather, are all major draws.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Do Indians Travel To Nepal?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> For a variety of reasons, Indians frequently choose Nepal as their vacation destination. While it is located abroad, it is one of India's closest neighbours. Furthermore, vacations in Nepal are not prohibitively expensive, which is one of the primary reasons why the country is a popular choice for Indian tourists.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Is Nepal Expensive For Tourists?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> If you want to stay in full-fledged luxury in Kathmandu and Pokhara, your vacation will be costly. However, if you are okay with the local culture, food, and accommodations, you can enjoy a low-cost vacation.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Nepal's National Dress?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Suruwal, Daura. (Source) Daura Suruwal is Nepal's national dress. Jang Bahadur Rana, Nepal's then-prime minister in the nineteenth century, introduced it. It is also widely worn by men in Sikkim and Darjeeling.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Nepal's National Animal?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The cow, which is sacred to Hindus, has been designated as Nepal's national animal in the country's newly unveiled secular Constitution. After years of political wrangling, Nepal adopted a new constitution on Monday. "As for Hindus, we have made the cow our national animal."</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
